com.faltro.houdoku.plugins.tracker

Interface Tracker

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TrackerOAuth
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AniList, GenericTrackerOAuth

    public interface Tracker
    A tracker is a website for users to individually track their manga/comic lists. These websites generally hold a database of series' with extensive information for each. Users can create a 'list' of series' that they are interested in, generally also being able to categorize them in various ways (i.e. "Reading", "Planning", "Completed"). Users are also able to record the number of chapters from each series that they have read.

    For this client, we want users to link with a tracker and have their lists be automatically updated. When they read a chapter in the client, their list should be updated. One of the primary difficulties faced here is that tracker websites often store series' under different names/titles. It is unfortunately necessary that we create an interface for the user to manually search each database in order to link it with a Series in their Library.

    See Also:
    com.faltro.houdoku.plugins.tracker

      • verifyAuthenticated

        void verifyAuthenticated()
                  throws NotImplementedException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Verify whether the client is actually authenticated with the server, regardless of a cached `authenticated` property.

        The isAuthenticated() property is updated, if necessary.

        This function is particularly useful to check whether any access token is still valid after the client was restarted.

        Throws:
        NotImplementedException - the operation has not yet been implemented for this tracker
        java.io.IOException - an IOException occurred when checking

      • updateChaptersRead

        void updateChaptersRead(java.lang.String id,
                        int num)
                 throws NotImplementedException,
                        NotAuthenticatedException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Safely update the number of chapters read for a series.

        If the user's number read is greater than the given value, the number on the tracker is not changed.

        Parameters:
        id - the series id
        num - the number of chapters read
        Throws:
        NotImplementedException - the operation has not yet been implemented for this tracker
        NotAuthenticatedException - the user is not authenticated
        java.io.IOException - an IOException occurred when updating
